title: (BBC) The Death Of Yugoslavia (3of6) Wars Of Independence
description:
(BBC) The Death Of Yugoslavia (3of6) 

Wars Of Independence The Balkans have a history of ethnic conflict that stretches back centuries. When the dictator Josip Broz "Tito" commanded Yugoslavia, his iron-fisted rule kept the inherent ethnic and religious divisions in check. But since his death and the collapse of Communism, war has been a constant of life in the former Yugoslavia.

This documentary examines the deep roots of the modern conflicts, then plunges into the heat of battle with extensive footage of the wars that have once again brought chilling accusations of "crimes against humanity." See how a former Communist functionary seized power by recasting himself as a strong-armed nationalist, and trace the fumbling efforts of the UN in this troubled region. 

This is a compelling look at the modern conflict with ancient roots that has claimed over a quarter million lives.

The Death of Yugoslavia (Serbian or Croatian: Smrt Jugoslavije) is a BBC documentary series first broadcast in 1995. It covers the collapse of the former Yugoslavia. It is notable in its combination of never-before-seen archive footage interspersed with interviews by most of the main players in the conflict, including Slobodan Milo?evi?, then President of Serbia. This format, pioneered by the programme&#039;s production company, Brian Lapping Associates, was very influential and the company produced many others in similar style.

The six parts were entitled:

Enter Nationalism
The Road to War
Wars of Independence
The Gates of Hell 
A Safe Area 
Pax Americana
